block.p: Parnell Anne Pratt, the daughter of Nancy and Keith Pratt of Duxbury, Mass., was married yesterday at the Pilgrim Church there to Stephen Scott Boeschenstein, a son of Josephine and William Boeschenstein of Perrysburg, Ohio. The Rev. Kenneth C. Landall, a Congregational minister, officiated at the ceremony, with the Rev. Joseph F. Mozer Jr., a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Boeschenstein, 31, is known as Polly. She is a school psychologist at the Greens Farms Elementary School in Westport, Conn. She graduated from St. Lawrence University and received a master's degree in school psychology from Tufts University. Her parents work in Duxbury, where her father is a senior sales executive with the Prudential Lighting Company, a manufacturer of architectural lighting systems, and her mother is an interior designer.

Parnell Anne Pratt, the daughter of Nancy and Keith Pratt of Duxbury, Mass., was married yesterday at the Pilgrim Church there to Stephen Scott Boeschenstein, a son of Josephine and William Boeschenstein of Perrysburg, Ohio. The Rev. Kenneth C. Landall, a Congregational minister, officiated at the ceremony, with the Rev. Joseph F. Mozer Jr., a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Mrs. Boeschenstein, 31, is known as Polly. She is a school psychologist at the Greens Farms Elementary School in Westport, Conn. She graduated from St. Lawrence University and received a master's degree in school psychology from Tufts University. Her parents work in Duxbury, where her father is a senior sales executive with the Prudential Lighting Company, a manufacturer of architectural lighting systems, and her mother is an interior designer.

Mr. Boeschenstein, 35, is a director and a senior consultant at the Optima Group, a management consulting and marketing business in Fairfield, Conn. He graduated from Georgetown University and received an M.B.A. from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor. His father retired as the chief executive of Owens Corning Fiberglas in Toledo, Ohio. The bridegroom's mother is a former board member of the National Council on Alcoholism and Drug Dependence and now sits on the board of the group's Toledo chapter.
